activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#10871
activity.text:
> @Naman-45 Can you wire this popup to the existing "View all" button instead of a new Full View button? In the overview table, fetch records only from the active statuses and display first. Along with it, fire an API for inactive statuses with limit 0, to decide if "View all" button needs to be displayed or not. On click can open up the new Popup. Let me know if you need any clarifications.
> 
> Here is an image for reference (Credits: @AdityaJ2305 ). This would also fix #11184 ![image](https://private-user-images.githubusercontent.com/37619282/420856703-56779fd2-62c1-4245-bd29-75683d7d7221.png?jwt=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..gxo1ULo_JLbCBPp7IMsaZNgD1SmC1AS-KxYnqdjdkwg)

Ok so I will remove Full View button and instead wire it up to the view all button? Now, as you said that you want to display all the active entries in the overview section so what all encounter statuses do you consider as active and which all inactive.

And In the overview section you want to display all the active statuses entries then what if they are more than 14 i.e; cannot be fetched in a single call, how do you want that case to be handled?

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11107
activity.text:
> @oathar, in some cases, creating a PR and informing the maintainers after that is okay, as all the issues can't always be assigned. I saw the issue, found it doable, and started working on it. After creating the PR, I noticed you were also working on it. Sorry about that.

That's okay if the issue is raised by the maintainer of the project, but this issue was raised by the contributor just like you.

Moreover in the contribution guidelines given, it is mentioned that you should first comment below the issue you want to work on.

This way you are creating an unhealthy environment among contributors.
